backend.title: Senior C# Developer
backend.description:
Offer description About Code Poets:
The name "Code Poets" reflects our deep appreciation for the artistry of programming.Software development is not just about writing lines of code but also about crafting elegant and creative solutions to complex problems.Our developers are like poets, using their skills and creativity to turn abstract ideas into functional, beautiful, and impactful digital products.
About the project:Our client Â is a pioneer in the field of Multi-Organ-Chip technology and has been driving innovations in biotechnology since Â 2010. Their commercially available HUMIMIC Multi-Organ-Chips provide a unique opportunity to biologically model the Â complexity of human organs and their interactions. Using cutting-edge technology in combination with robotics Â and artificial intelligence enables informed decisions in the drug development process. At the same time, by using Â human tissue, it reduces the dependency on animal testing and rationalizes clinical studies, offering the potential for cheaper medicines for all.Â Â Main Responsibilities:âœ”ï¸ Development of planning and analysis software for automation systemsÂ âœ”ï¸ Design and implementation of distributed software systemsÂ âœ”ï¸ Collaboration in an interdisciplinary team to translate TissUse's needs and requirements into software solutions
RequirementsÂ âœ”ï¸ Backend development experience, e.g. with C# or NodeJSÂ âœ”ï¸ Excellent knowledge of C# or an equivalent object-oriented programming languageÂ âœ”ï¸ Experience with frontend web frameworks such as Angular and VueJSÂ âœ”ï¸ Good knowledge of JavaScript and TypeScriptÂ âœ”ï¸ Familiarity with database systems e.g. MSSQL or SQLiteÂ âœ”ï¸ Knowledge of working with Linux and Windows serversÂ âœ”ï¸ Good communication skills in German and/or English (both written and spoken)Â âœ”ï¸ Experience with multi-platform frameworks such as Electron is advantageousÂ âœ”ï¸ Experience in agile software development is desirableÂ 
What we offer:ğŸ’¸ PLN 18 - 22000 net (B2B), depending on seniority, tech stack and verification of technical skills at the interviewğŸ“ƒ Form of contract: B2B, we are looking for people for long-term cooperation, not only for the projectğŸŒ Working remotely most of the time, but this job includes business trips to Berlin, especially in the onboarding timeğŸ”´ Development in an innovative project in the field of life scienceğŸŸ¢ The team of experts open to feedbackğŸ”µ Total transparency within the companyâ° Start of work: to be discussedÂ Â Recruitment process (online):1ï¸âƒ£ Phone call screening (max 15 minutes)2ï¸âƒ£ HR interview (60 minutes)3ï¸âƒ£ Live coding with one of our developers (60 minutes)4ï¸âƒ£ Interview with the clientÂ 5ï¸âƒ£ Decision read more

We offer

The chance to advance and evolve while being guided by experiencedÂ Testers and Team Leaders
a highly extensive knowledge base, including training videos related toÂ testing or using testing tools

What is the recruitment process for this position?

Please fill in the form provided by us. It will take you about 5 minutes toÂ complete it.
If your application matches our offer, we send you a simple task to confirm your skills.
If the task is done correctly, we arrange a meeting with our Team Leader. This type of conversation usually takes about 30 minutes
The next step is meeting with the Team Leader and one more person from the QA Team. This type of conversation usually takes about 60 minutes.
If both conversations with the Team Leader is successful, welcome onboard!

backend.title: Senior Software Engineer, Relay
backend.description:
Offer description **Our compensation structure is the base salary and equity in the form of restricted stock units.
Senior Software Engineer, Relay
What is Box?
Box is the market leader for Cloud Content Management. Our mission is to power how the world works together. Box is partnering with enterprise organizations to accelerate their digital transformation by creating a single platform for secure content management, collaboration, and workflow. We have an amazing opportunity to further establish ourselves as leaders in the space, and we need strong advocates to help us achieve that goal.Â 
By joining Box, you will have the unique opportunity to help capture a majority of this developing market and define what content management looks like for the digital enterprise. Today, Box powers 100,000+ businesses, including many top Fortune 500 companies, who trust our secure collaboration platform to manage the entire content lifecycle.Our Warsaw office is an incredibly exciting addition to our EMEA expansion. We're already in the UK, France, and Germany, and the new Poland location will act as a global engineering and product development hub alongside our headquarters in Redwood City, California.
Why Box needs you:
Many of the world's largest enterprises rely on Box to securely store their content, and we are helping to unlock the potential of their content through the development of additional core capabilities, like Box Relay. We are expanding Relay with additional features and supporting products.
Our Workflow team, based in Poland, works together to delight our users by enabling them to automate routine tasks. Our products save users time and deliver results in consistent manner. As our team in Poland continues to grow and take on building new product, we are looking for a seasoned engineer who can own large components of the system and work independently. In this role, your work will impact millions of users, who use Relay to get their work done on a daily basis.
Percentage of Time Spent:

55% coding
10% documentation
20% bug fixes
15% meetings

EQUAL OPPORTUNITYÂ We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability, and any other protected ground of discrimination under applicable human rights legislationâ€. For details on how we protect your information when you apply, please see ourÂ Personnel Privacy Notice. For more details on how Box Poland protects your information, please see ourÂ Supplemental Personnel and Candidate Privacy Notice.Â  read more

frontend.title: Senior Frontend Developer
frontend.description:
Offer description About LegalZoom
We're here to make legal help accessible to all. LegalZoom transformed the legal industry with theÂ launch of our online services and groundbreaking technology in 2001. Since then, millions ofÂ customers have counted on us to officially start and run businesses, protect brands and intellectualproperty, and look after loved ones through wills and trusts.
As the industry leader for over 20 years, innovation remains at the center of all we do. We're creativeÂ thinkers and problem solvers with a passion for building legal and tax products that make a positiveÂ impact on the world, and we're always looking for exceptional people to push us further.Â With us, you'll do work that's as rewarding as it is challenging with a team where every voice mattersÂ and diversity, equality, and inclusion are truly embraced. Together, we'll continue to democratize theÂ law and make a real difference in the lives of millions.
Overview
Your work is consistently of high quality. You solve difficult problems, applying appropriate technologiesÂ and best practices. You work with your team to invent, design and build software that is stable andÂ performant. You write code that an Software Development Engineer unfamiliar with the system canÂ understand. Your solutions are pragmatic. You are proficient in a broad range of design approaches andÂ know when it is appropriate to use them (and when it is not). You do things with the proper level ofÂ complexity the first time (or at least minimize incidental complexity). You consider the legacy of the codeÂ you produce, limiting the use of short-term workarounds. You create flexible software withoutover-engineering. You make appropriate trade-offs, re-use where possible, and are judicious about introducing dependencies. read more

frontend.title: Senior Frontend Software Engineer
frontend.description:
Offer description What youâ€™ll do at Jamf:
At Jamf, we empower people to be their best selves and do their best work. We are looking for a Senior Frontend Engineer to join our team to help us create, maintain and continually improve products that help our customers find success with the Apple platform.Â Â 
You will participate in an agile delivery team that produces and delivers new features and supports existing functionality with high quality and reliability. You will be a key component in Jamf remaining the best of breed in endpoint management of Apple devices.
Jamf is a fast-paced environment. Successful team members are adaptable to the change that is a part of software development. Our goal at Jamf is to ship the highest quality product to solve our customer's problems.Â Â 
This role is remote inÂ Poland. We are only able to accept applications for those based inÂ PolandÂ and have sponsorship to live and work inÂ Poland.
What you can expect to do in this role:

Break down customer problems into work you and the team can execute on
Independently complete tasks from start to finish with high quality
Ability to communicate technical concepts to stakeholders
Use your knowledge of Engineering best practices to ask the right questions, solveÂ problems and build great software with a high level of quality
Produce designs for new and existing features
Clearly communicate technical concepts with others in the organization (TechnicalÂ Communication, Support, Product and Cloud)
Performs all job responsibilities in alignment with the core values, mission andÂ purpose of the organization
Adheres to the highest moral, ethical and legal standards to deliver and environmentÂ that promotes respect, innovation and creativity
Supports and promotes a positive, inclusive workplace one in which the talents andÂ strengths of our increasingly diverse workforce are welcomed, further developed andÂ manifested in our work.

frontend.title: Senior Frontend  Engineer (Angular)
frontend.description:
Offer description As a leader in Inpatient Journey Analytics,Â Kontakt.ioÂ optimizes processes and resources by revealing how patients, staff, and equipment move through your care delivery. Using AI, IoT, and RTLS,Â Kontakt.ioÂ helps health systems uncover waste, streamline capacity, improve workflows, and help patients and staff feel seen and valued.
Our portfolio of complete IoT and location solutions combine hardware, software, and cloud to bring real-time visibility, analytics, and AI to operations. Today, we serve over 2,000 customers across diverse sizes and industries, from transportation and logistics to manufacturing, healthcare, airports, governments and public spaces. They use Kontakt.io to reduce emergency incident time, decrease asset search-times, introduce activity-based-costing, automate manual processes, digitize physical order traceability or prevent machine downtimes read more

fullstack.title: Senior Software Engineer
fullstack.description:
Offer description Working Environment:
With new cloud applications, we want to further increase the networking of our members and customers in the DATEV ecosystem. You will work on changing tasks in a modern DevOps team. Thereby you will use agile development methods and current technologies to develop a new generation of DATEV cloud applications. By DevOps, we don't just mean the simple use of tools or roles, but rather the team spirit, "we build it we run it". You will work closely with product teams and will be responsible with your team for a product for a certain period of time. We are interested in long-term employment relationships and look forward to you becoming an integral part of our team.
This is us:
DATEV is more than just a green square, we are one of Europeâ€™s largest software and IT service providers, based in Nuremberg. The passion of our more than 8,500 employees is to help more than 500,000 customers on their way to digitalized business processes.Â 
Our customers rely on our cloud or on-premise solutions and our mobile apps, for example to process about 14 million payrolls every month.
As a cooperative we encourage collaboration. It focusses on our principles: Driving progress. Shaping the future. Achieving success together. We combine consistency with innovation.Â 
Diversity, equity and inclusion are the essential basis for us to ensure that everyone can participate equally in working life. DATEV takes responsibility for this matter every day. #WeareDATEV!Â 
We look forward to receiving your application using our career site and to getting to know you.Â 
Our Benefits:

Attractive payment ranges based on your qualification, experience, and skills as well as many other financial incentives (for exampleÂ sharing the costs of sportive activities,Â private medical care, â€¦).
Homeoffice in the sense of mobile, location-independent work within Poland including the corresponding technical equipment.
Learning possibilities and education related to advance your career and your personal skills, as well as numerous internal communities like a large internal community of software engineering professionals and opportunities to visit conferences as a speaker or attendee.
Long term employment contracts
We have a lot more to offer... do you want to find out?Â ğŸ˜Š

fullstack.title: Lead Full Stack Engineer ( .NET / React )
fullstack.description:
Offer description We are looking for an experienced, proactiveÂ Lead Full Stack EngineerÂ (.NET/React)Â who has proven experience with e-commerce public operational web sitesÂ to join our development team.
Our customerâ€“integrated Shipping Services have set itself apart as an independent carrier with a fresh, unique approach. His strategy as a global niche carrier offers distinctive advantages to customers worldwide. They have created an innovative, efficient network that ensures stable, reliable services; and we have made it their mission to focus on the needs of our customers, which stand at the heart of all our decisions. The main idea of our product is to operate in select trades, where it has a competitive advantage and where it can provide superior service. We maintain a flexible partnership approach with other major carriers, and our new line structure is a much-needed alternative to customers concerned about the current alliance-dominated market. read more

fullstack.title: Senior Fullstack Engineer (part-time)
fullstack.description:
Offer description Weâ€™re looking for a Senior Fullstack Engineer to join our team in Warsaw or remotely.
Sunscrapers is an elite Python development company that helps clients set up dedicated development teams in Poland, made of the most talented, experienced, and motivated software engineers.
Since 2010, weâ€™ve been working with ambitious US and European scaleups, SMBs and enterprises on delivering digital products and extending in-house development teams.
Weâ€™ve earned our reputation by combining a passion for technology, the highest quality standards, and our unique â€˜Product-Developer Fitâ€™ hiring process.
We are looking for a Senior Fullstack Engineer to join one of our remote projects.

Our client provides cross-cultural training and consulting. Their main product is the e-learning platform, which provides information on culture and behavior in more than 160 countries. Companies and organizations worldwide use the platform to help employees develop cultural awareness and the ability to work with people from different cultures.
Currently, they are focusing on providing companies with data on how they compare to other companies in a given sector regarding inclusiveness.
The client is looking for an experienced programmer who can work independently and has experience working with non-technical founders. This person should also understand legacy code.

Important note: the estimated working time we have provided for the developer we want to hire is three months. read more

fullstack.title: Senior Fullstack Development Engineer
fullstack.description:
Offer description Remitly is on a mission to transform the lives of immigrants and their families by providing the most trusted financial products and services on the planet. Since 2011, we have been tirelessly delivering on our promises to immigrants sending their hard earned money home. Today, we are reimagining international payments at scale and building new products to create deeper relationships with our customers and their loved ones across the globe. Join over 2,700 employees across 10 offices who are growing their careers while having a positive impact on people globally.
Remitly is registered as a Money Services Business in the U.S., Canada, EU, United Kingdom, Singapore and Australia. Each of these jurisdictions require, among other items, that Remitly maintain a comprehensive Risk and Compliance Program.
About the RoleTo succeed in this role, you should enjoy being in a startup environment and working hands-on with engineers and product teams across the company. You'll be member of a team in KrakÃ³w, which is part of a bigger global team. You'll be reporting to an Engineering Manager. Our stack is backend micro-services with simple front-end applications for back-office needs. You will contribute to development to different elements of these applications. This will include building foundations for new UI and new backend components and sun setting existing UIs. This role is an opportunity to be involved in early stages of a product lifecycle.
Our Benefits

Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP)
Unlimited paid time off, subject to approval
min. 26 days paid holidays + additional Remitly days off
Royalties (KUP)
Hybrid or remote work arrangements with an office in a KrakÃ³w City Centre
Commuting to work expense/remote work expenses reimbursement
Health/Dental Coverage - LUX MED VIP for employee and family
Life Insurance
Travel insurance for employee and family
Sodexo Lunch Card/Multisport
Education / Conferences Budget
Equipment of your choice
Mental health program for employee and their dependents
Family planning program
Employee Pension Plan (PPK)
Headphones Reimbursement
Referral bonus scheme

fullstack.title: Engineering Manager
fullstack.description: Offer description Company DescriptionWeâ€™re the worldâ€™s leading sports technology company, at the intersection between sports, media, and betting. More than 1,700 sports federations, media outlets, betting operators, and consumer platforms across 120 countries rely on our know-how and technology to boost their business.Job DescriptionBased in Wroclaw in PolandJob Type:Â Permanent Contract (UoP)OVERVIEW:Join our Data Acquisition Tribe and become a part of the global fast-growing success of Sportradar. A technology first software development company with high emphasis on achieving technical excellence and building services on best practice cloud principles. Mutually beneficial partnerships are the cornerstone of our business. We partner with the largest sport federations in the world including UEFA, NBA, NHL, MLB, ITF and many more.Our vision is built on long-term relationships with all our clients, backed by innovative and competitive services and solutions. We build our own product and believe in â€˜you build it, you own itâ€™, so we want to give our squads autonomy to choose the right solutions.THE CHALLENGE:Due to our success, we are continuously hiring motivated engineers and we want to ensure we scale our engineering leadership accordinglyÂ In Data Acquisition Tribe we create solutions to collect sports data globally for more than 60 different sportsÂ We want to build yet better solutions and we want to give you a realâ€¯opportunity to influence design and technologyâ€¯choices.Â JOB PROFILE:We are looking for an engineering leader who loves working with both people and software. We expect that you, as a leader, are passionate about building an environment where software engineers can achieve their full potential. As an engineer, you have a great understanding of modern development techniques and can be a partner for the team to choose the best solutions. We expect that you can be an advocate of clean code, and clean architecture, TDD (Test Driven Development), pair programming and always welcome feedback. You will be given a lot of autonomy and we want you to use the most of it and drive the team towards technical excellence. We hope you feel learning is a natural part of your workday and you have a high interest in keeping up with current best practices in your areas of expertise. In the role you will:Lead a team of diverse and talented software engineers with various levels of expertise.Â Coach engineers to grow, by supporting and giving them frequent feedback, setting individual goals, and assessing performance.Â Facilitate technical discussions and help to make the best decisions.Â Be a member of the Tribe Engineering Leadership Team shaping the culture and engineering practices of the entire Tribe.Â Contribute to the code (we do not need you to be the best programmer in the team, but we believe in â€˜walk the talkâ€™Â )Â OUR OFFER:Work and develop within an inspiring and fast-growing company and become a domain expert in the exciting world of real-time sports dataÂ Build a high performing team of your dreamsÂ Grow as a leader with our engineering leadership teamÂ Shape the culture of our brand-new Wroclaw officeÂ Influence the future of Sportradar, you will be directly contributing to products used by our clients in the global sports businessÂ Enjoy a high degree of freedom, decide on your own workday, choose methods and solutions that you know will bring the most valueÂ Collaborate with colleagues from all over the world (Engineering offices in Europe, Asia and US)Â Be a part of a company, which culture promotes social aspects, sports, physical exercise, and fun.Â Competitive salary and benefitsÂ  read more
